member.name: Windows.EcClose
member.summary: The EcClose function closes a handle received from other Event Collector functions. Any handle returned by an event collector management API call must be closed using this call when the user is finished with the handle. The handle becomes invalid when this function is successfully called.
member.param: A valid open handle returned from an event collector management API call.

member.name: Windows.EcDeleteSubscription

summary.para: The EcDeleteSubscription function deletes an existing subscription that is specified by the SubscriptionName parameter.
The function fails if the security descriptor of the subscription does not permit delete access for the calling process.
If the subscription is active at the moment this API is called, then the subscription is deactivated.

member.param: The subscription to be deleted.
Reserved, must be 0.

member.name: Windows.EcEnumNextSubscription
member.summary: The EcEnumNextSubscription function continues the enumeration of the subscriptions registered on the local machine.
member.param: The handle to the enumerator object that is returned from the function.
The size of the user-supplied buffer (in chars) to store the subscription name.
The user-supplied buffer to store the subscription name.

The size of the user-supplied buffer that is used by the function on successful return, or the size that is necessary to store the subscription name when the function fails with ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_BUFFER.

member.name: Windows.EcGetObjectArrayProperty
member.summary: The EcGetObjectArrayProperty function retrieves property values from a handle to an array of event source properties. The array contains property values for the event sources of a subscription.
member.param: A handle to an array of properties for the event sources for a subscription. An array handle that is returned by the method when the EcSubscriptionEventSources value is passed into the PropertyId parameter.

The property identifier for properties in the array. Specify a value from the enumeration. Get the Address, Enabled, UserName, and Password properties in the array by specifying the EcSubscriptionEventSourceAddress, EcSubscriptionEventSourceEnabled, EcSubscriptionEventSourceUserName, or EcSubscriptionEventSourcePassword values.
The index of the array that specifies which event source to get the property from.
Reserved. Must be 0.
The size of the buffer that contains the value of the property. The size must be at least the size of an value.
The user-supplied buffer to store property value into.

The size of the user-supplied buffer that is used by the function on successful return, or the size that is necessary to store the property value when the function fails with ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_BUFFER.

member.name: Windows.EcGetObjectArraySize
member.summary: The EcGetObjectArraySize function retrieves the size (the number of indexes) of the array of property values for the event sources of a subscription.
member.param: A handle to the array from which to get the size. The array contains property values for the event sources of a subscription. The array handle is returned by the method when the EcSubscriptionEventSources value is passed into the PropertyId parameter.
The size of the array (the number of indexes).

member.name: Windows.EcGetSubscriptionProperty
member.summary: The EcGetSubscriptionProperty function retrieves a specific property value from a subscription object. The subscription object is specified by the handle passed into the Subscription parameter.
member.param: The handle to the subscription object.

An identifier that specifies which property of the subscription to get. Specify a value from the enumeration. If you specify the EcSubscriptionEventSources value, then a handle to an array (EC_OBJECT_ARRAY_PROPERTY_HANDLE) will be returned. You can then use the and functions to get and set the Address, Enabled, UserName, and Password properties in the array.
Reserved. Must be NULL.
The size of the user-supplied buffer to store the property value into.
The user-supplied buffer to store property value into.
The size of the user-supplied buffer that is used by the function on successful return, or the size that is necessary to store the property value when function fails with ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_BUFFER.

member.name: Windows.EcGetSubscriptionRunTimeStatus
member.summary: The EcGetSubscriptionRunTimeStatus function retrieves the run time status information for an event source of a subscription or the subscription itself. The subscription is specified by its name. If the event source is NULL, then the status for the overall subscription is retrieved.
member.param: The name of the subscription to get the run time status information from.

An identifier that specifies which run time status information to get from the subscription. Specify a value from the enumeration. The EcSubscriptionRunTimeStatusEventSources value can be used to obtain the list of event sources associated with a subscription.
The name of the event source to get the status from. Each subscription can have multiple event sources.
Reserved. Must be NULL.
The size of the user-supplied buffer that will hold the run time status information.
The user-supplied buffer that will hold the run time status information. The buffer will hold the appropriate value depending on the value passed into the StatusInfoId parameter.
The size of the user supplied buffer that is used by the function on successful return, or the size that is necessary to store the property value when function fails with ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_BUFFER.

member.name: Windows.EcInsertObjectArrayElement
member.summary: The EcInsertObjectArrayElement function inserts an empty object into an array of property values for the event sources of a subscription. The object is inserted at a specified array index.
member.param: A handle to the array in which the object is inserted into. The array contains property values for the event sources of a subscription. The array handle is returned by the method when the EcSubscriptionEventSources value is passed into the Subscription parameter.
An array index indicating where to insert the object.

member.name: Windows.EcOpenSubscription
member.summary: The EcOpenSubscription function is used to open an existing subscription or create a new subscription according to the flag value specified.
member.param: Specifies the name of the subscription. The value provided for this parameter should be unique within the computer's scope.

An access mask that specifies the desired access rights to the subscription. Use the EC_READ_ACCESS or EC_WRITE_ACCESS constants to specify the access rights. The function fails if the security descriptor of the subscription does not permit the requested access for the calling process.
A value specifying whether a new or existing subscription will be opened. Use the EC_CREATE_NEW, EC_OPEN_ALWAYS, or EC_OPEN_EXISTING constants.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, it returns a handle (EC_HANDLE) to a new subscription object. Returns NULL otherwise, in which case use the function to obtain the error code.

member.name: Windows.EcOpenSubscriptionEnum
member.summary: The EcOpenSubscriptionEnum function is creates a subscription enumerator to enumerate all registered subscriptions on the local machine.
member.param: Reserved. Must be 0.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, it returns a handle (EC_HANDLE) to a new subscription enumerator object. Returns NULL otherwise, in which case use the function to obtain the error code.

member.name: Windows.EcRemoveObjectArrayElement
member.summary: The EcRemoveObjectArrayElement function removes an element from an array of objects that contain property values for the event sources of a subscription.
member.param: A handle to the array in which to remove the element. The array contains property values for the event sources of a subscription. The array handle is returned by the method when the EcSubscriptionEventSources value is passed into the Subscription parameter.
The index of the element to remove from the array.

member.name: Windows.EcRetrySubscription
member.summary: The EcRetrySubscription function is used to retry connecting to the event source of a subscription that is not connected.
member.param: The name of the subscription to which to connect.

The name of the event source of the subscription. This parameter is optional and can be NULL. This parameter must be NULL when the subscription is source initiated. If this parameter is NULL, the entire subscription will be retried.
Reserved. Must be NULL.

member.name: Windows.EcSaveSubscription
member.summary: The EcSaveSubscription function saves subscription configuration information. This function should be called whenever new values are added or updated to the subscription by the method. If the subscription is enabled, the subscription will be activated when it is saved.
member.param: The handle to the subscription object.
Reserved. Must be NULL.

member.name: Windows.EcSetObjectArrayProperty
member.summary: The EcSetObjectArrayProperty function sets a property value in an array of property values for the event sources of a subscription.
member.param: A handle to the array that contains the property value to set. The array contains property values for the event sources of a subscription. The array handle is returned by the method when the EcSubscriptionEventSources value is passed into the Subscription parameter.

An identifier that specifies which property to set. Specify a value from the enumeration. Set the Address, Enabled, UserName, and Password properties in the array by specifying the EcSubscriptionEventSourceAddress, EcSubscriptionEventSourceEnabled, EcSubscriptionEventSourceUserName, or EcSubscriptionEventSourcePassword values.
The index of the object in the array to set a property value on.
Reserved. Must be 0.
The value of the property.

member.name: Windows.EcSetSubscriptionProperty
member.summary: The EcSetSubscriptionProperty function sets new values or updates existing values of a subscription. New values set through this method will not be active unless they are saved by the method.
member.param: The handle to the subscription object.
A value from the enumeration that specifies which property of the subscription to set.
Reserved. Must be 0.
The value of the property to set for the indicated subscription property.
